page.title: 04EMERGENCY SERVICES
page.content:
Barton{Fire Station}is unmanned and operated by 12 part-time firemen. The men are called to the station by a bleeper which they carry at all times, and the first 6 men to arrive there are used to deal with the emergency. The station is responsible for a large area around Barton which includes Goxhill, Thornton Curtis and Bonby. It houses 2 appliances, 1 fire engine and 1 water tender. The major incident of 1985 was the collapse of a building in Barton Market Place.
Barton{Ambulance Station}is operated by 7 full-time men who work 2 separate day shifts. All men are on standby from 11 p.m. until 7 a.m., and are contacted by telephone if needed. The station houses 2 ambulances, and is responsible for the south bank area within a 20 mile radius of Barton.
